weather_report:
The weather in Downtown San Francisco dances on the edge of a summer day, presenting a curious interplay of sun and cloud. The morning dawned with a whisper of drizzle, now replaced by a tentative brightness as the sun peeks through variable clouds. The air carries a gentle breeze from the west-southwest, adding a hint of respite to the warmest moments of the day, which nestle near 64 degrees before descending to a cooler embrace around 62. This gentle transition elicits a sense of comfortable ambivalence, ideal for those who wish to wander about the city. 

While a light marine layer hugs the coastline, obscuring the more distant vistas, one can still enjoy the warmth tempered by cool gusts. Dress in layers—perhaps a light sweater over a t-shirt, providing both comfort and a nod to the ever-changing moods of San Francisco’s capricious weather. The city’s heart, aglow in this ephemeral sunlight, beckons for a quiet afternoon stroll through its winding streets or a modest gathering at a cozy café. There’s ample time to savor a book in a park or engage in gentle conversation while embracing the enchanting dance of the fog that may settle in as the evening approaches, softly draping the skyline under a quiet, gray blanket.
